page.title: 03British Show Jumping Record
page.content: Mr D Beard is a resident of Garton and a farmer.From 1937 to 1979 he held the British record for the highest show jump.On the 25th June 1937 Donald Beard broke the British record by jumping 7'-6 1/4" on a bay gelding, 16.2 hands, called Swank. Mr Beard started show jumping in 1933 and rode ponies all over the country. For two years he rode for Bertram Mill's Circus.He has won numerous medals and trophies including the Athlone Cup,the Prince of Wales Cup and the Khan Cup.He would have liked to have won the King George Cup; the nearest he got was third at White City. His British record was broken in 1979 by Nick Skelton riding an Everest Doubling Glazing horse called Lastic.
